review_title: Norfolk Southern Co-op opportunities is a good place to start
job_title: Inter-modal Systems Coop in Norfolk, VA
pros: The pay is really good, people are friendly. There is a lot of growth opportunities and many of the employees there will be retiring in mass amounts within the next five years.
cons: Sometimes, depending on how busy your supervisor is, there is downtime where you have nothing to do.  Norfolk Southern is also old fashioned,

job_title: Operations Supervisor Trainee in Macon, GA
pros: Decent Benefits and good for college graduates with no experience.
cons: Poorly organized, micromanaged, long hours, and almost half of your monthly pay comes out in taxes and railroad retirement.

job_title: Data Warehouse Architect in Atlanta, GA
pros: The company pays on time. There is some work hours flexibility but no remote work. No overtime work is required.
cons: No remote work. Currently very unstable for contractors. The company is moving to work only with offshore vendors for IT

pros: For all intents and purposes the pay increases have stagnated however it's still better than the average median wage in the US. The healthcare benefits are top notch relatively speaking compared to most companies.
cons: This is a tough nosed operation which is typical in the transportation industry. Expect to perform at a high level with a high amount of stress to go around

review_title: Norfolk Southern's Information Technology Department is a great place to work!
job_title: Information Technology Manager in Atlanta, GA
pros: Norfolk Southern runs a broad selections of computer platforms.  NS writes most of the transportation software used by the company.  Great people!
cons:
The commute to mid-town Atlanta is not fun.  
Employees pay more into Railroad Retirement than other people pay into Social Security but Railroad Retirement pays  more upon retirement.

job_title: Signal Maintainer in New Orleans, LA
pros: Good pay, slightly above average benefits, and excellent retirement.
cons: Always on call. The job tears into most if not all of your personal life. It's next to impossible to have family time. Also, I have some issues with some safety practices.

review_title: Good pay, good retirement, zero life
pros: good pay, good benefits (mostly) and a good retirement
cons: on call 24/7, 365...no scheduled days off, no pay on holidays, when you punch out of work, they can call in 10 hrs to move another train, no home life at all and the minute your hired, they're trying to fire you

job_title: Operations Research Co-op in Atlanta, GA
pros: new technologies, brainy people, lots of areas to learn and people are very helpful. On the job training
cons: average age of employees would be 35 as most of them are doctorates which is great for a learning enviroment

pros: Great Benefits, Good company, easy work, motivated people who want to sincerely be successful within the company. Company wants you to grow within the company too.
cons: Monotonous work, zero sick days, always working overtime, working in a cubicle, not a lot of face to face interaction

review_title: Great benefits. You will earn them.
pros: Great benefits and opportunity for growth. Pay is top notch for what you actually do however the responsibility you carry is huge.
cons: A lot of 'us and them' behavior in reference to agreement employee and non-agreement employee relations. (Management)

pros: The benefits are good.  There is a pension plan.  They have a bonus, but it is seldom paid out.  3 weeks of vacation.
cons: Management is not focused on developing their people.  Salary and pay increases are not very competitive with the market, so everyone ends leaving.

pros: The pay is good. Best retirement in the country. If you are a driven individual that wants to make a major impact on your assigned territory, this job is for you.
cons: Very Long hours and on call are a part of the job. Be aware if you are someone that has prior responsibilities or is not willing to put in the time.

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Met very bright, dedicated people.  I learned a lot from my work, so it was worth every bit of the 12 hour day / night shifts.
cons: IT Management fascinated by collegiate or Industry credentials, rather than ability to excel and produce results.  If you're not <30 yrs old, look elsewhere.

review_title: Great company to work for.. Lots of opportunities to grow
pros:
NS is a growing company and has great opportunities for growth inside and outside your group. Also technical and non technical growth is encouraged. 
People are very helpful.
cons:
Pay is definitely on the lower side. 
Transparency is lacking across departments especially when it comes to sharing data and insights.

pros: Good pay, Great benefits, a smart time to enter the railroad industry
cons: Slow to change, terrible hours and no overtime.  Negative attitudes all around.  Union vs. management still an issue

pros: Good money, good retirement. Road TM have a lot of freedom when the Ops are running good. If you get in good with someone who is moving up you will be in good shape.
cons: If you're not handling folks your gonna be in trouble. Upper management expects ATMs and TMs to have employee discipline handlings on a monthly basis.

review_title: Good Pay, Family and Lifestyle suffers
pros: Pay and Benifits are good
cons:
Other railroads pay more for the position

Management finds ways to make things your fault, regardless of who may be responsible

The work schedule is unpredictable until you have a set schedule 

No parking at the office, either have to use public transportation or pay in parking garages

review_title: Exciting company to intern with, lots of learning and unique experiences.
pros:
Tons of examples of mechanical engineering put into practice
Good pay for internship
1st shift for interns
cons:
Long hours for supervisors as with any job
Sometimes not a lot of work for interns, so make sure to ask for things to do, they’re very good about letting you see many different things and jobs

review_title: Pay is good insurance is good and cool coworkers.
pros: The insurance and the money. Really relaxed as long as work is done you hear nothing from anyone. Provide you with ice-cream in the summer.
cons: Way to much down time and the union dues which no one can tell me what they are being used for.

pros: Pays well, but you won't have time or live in a place where you can enjoy it. There really are no pros other than the money.
cons: 60+ hours/week, no holidays off, bad healthcare. Company doesn't care about your health or livelihood AT ALL. There is a lot of animosity between craft employees and management. Everyone that works at NS seems to be miserable all the time. Terrible working environment. I have been much happier since i quit.

pros: The coworkers that I worked with made going to work enjoyable.
cons: Every time a new shop manager would get hired, he would stir up the hornets nest by abolishing jobs, and making new rules to make a name for themselves. There's no work to life balance.

pros: Very good money. Retirement promises are good. You learn how to look ahead while looking behind to watch your back. Health care still good but...
cons: Work life can be rough if you don't fit in with the local clique. No sleep pattern whatsoever. You will be called at anytime, all hours of the day.

pros: Good pay, good benefits. Paid training.
cons: Constant bumping off shifts, a lot of people had Tuesdays Wednesday off.  10years atleast before you could make it to 1st shift. High layoff rates due to PSR which caused me to be laid off.

pros:
Variety of work
Pay and benefits
Equipment well maintained in general
Great history of company
Stock price goes up over time
cons:
Married to job not family
Militaristic supervisors
Nights and weekends
Too many merger employees not satisfied
Union is too self focused

review_title: Great company for young professionals. Plenty of upward mobility for young managers.
pros: Company is making large efforts to improve company culture. Competitive salaries and benefits. It's easy to gain industry knowledge and relationships that can be leveraged outside of the company.
cons: NS is a 24/7 operation. Several jobs are subject to shift work, no holiday's off, being on call, etc.

pros: Good pay and benefits are about the only reason to work for NS as a trainmaster, which is the equivalent of a transportation operations manager.
cons: Working on call 24/7/365. 80-100 work weeks. No time for family. Hostile work climate: no one trusts anyone and many in management are clawing their way to the top, with no regard for ethics.

review_title: It's not a good place to work
pros: Pay is pretty good but there isn't any overtime. The co workers for the most part are good to work with.
cons: So mismanaged. The supervision is horrible. Most have no business being a supervisor. They hide in the weeds and bushes and watch you work waiting for you to make a mistake. They run the place by fear and intimidation. They WILL fire you for any little thing. You have to be in the union and it's pointless.

pros: Good pay for being right out of college. Looks great on a resume.
cons: Horrible middle and upper management. Be prepared to be treated like crap from middle and upper management. As a MT you will often find yourself picking up garbage, shuttling crews for hours, working middle managements off days etc. Please avoid taking this position directly out of college.

pros: Railroad retirement is excellent, but you pay significantly for it.
cons: Employees are undervalued and underpaid.

review_title: Very Happy I Joined the Team
pros: Enjoy my coworkers, opportunities for promotion within the company, good benefits with matching 401k, everyone is approachable and willing to help.
cons: There are no cons to this job.

review_title: Stay Away! Railroaded is not a term of endearment.
pros: Decent wages for people with high school education.
cons:
Management advances by writing up subordinates.
Benefits are declining with each new contract.
On-call schedule (365 days a year)
If you try to use personal or vacation days, supervisors ridicule you for trying to take time off.
No Work-Life balance (0%)

review_title: Great place to work - Lots of opportunity
job_title: Business Process Manager in Norfolk, VA
pros:
Flexible hours depending on department
Lots of advancement opportunities
Decent vacation time and unlimited sick days
cons:
Poor management makes or breaks your job (same as anywhere else)
Moving to Downtown Atlanta - major traffic
No remote location jobs

pros: The people were great and very welcoming. They take the time to teach you about the railroad industry.
cons: It was very unorganized at first. No one had a plan as to what my responsibilities originally were.

pros: 1 step above unemployment-barely. Railroad retirement, but I recommend getting that by working for a different railroad-any other railroad! Decent insurance, which is declining as well.
cons: Don't get injured off the job, get diagnosed with cancer, or have a heart attack-you'll be fired either before you return to work or while you're getting treatment.

job_title: Customer Care Agent in Atlanta, GA
pros: The IT Helpdesk has a great work environment in Midtown Atlanta. They have great benefits, including great vacation allowance and 401K Plan.
cons: Working at a 24/7 Helpdesk has its cons as my work week includes weekends and sometimes  holidays, if there aren't enough volunteers.

pros: decent benefits, pays well but only sometimes
cons: lack of communication, constantly jerking you around on paying you by terms setup in the contract, poor management

review_title: Great Place for a Long Term Career
pros: Pay/Vacation/Retirement/Work-Life balance/career opportunities/quality of co-workers/truly diverse culture.
cons: Not knowing if we will be moving to Atlanta or not.  They are not saying 'yes' but they are not saying 'no'.

pros: The pay is great, supervisors are knowledgeable and good to work for.
cons: Never knowing where you will be working. I went from Northern Ohio to Southern West Virginia to North Central Virginia all in 4 weeks. The company boasts record profits then furloughed 140 signal maintainers.

pros: Good salary. Decent benefits. There is a pension forever away.
cons: Your life is no longer yours. You belong to the railroad now. They have you tethered with a phone. I work 60 hours a week and get 2 rest days. I'm looking for another job asap. The "on the job training"is also subpar.

review_title: Good company - hard to move up
pros: Some of the people are the best asset this company has. But they don't understand the needs of the new generations of your workers who need more than the employees of the last century.
cons: Hard to move up; no clear path to advancement, no matter what you bring to the company

review_title: The Best Job I Ever Had!
pros: Amazing benefits. Friendly and comfortable environment. They welcomed me in with open arms. I have never worked for a company that cared so much about their employees and helping others.
cons: I can't think of any.

review_title: Over worked when needed and furloughed after 5 years with them.
pros:
Insurance 
Pay 
401k match 
Advancements
cons:
Just a number here.
Not cared for or about by the company.
Over worked.
Lots of write ups for petty stuff

review_title: Started out great but gradually worsened.
pros: They pay good, and you have a lot of autonomy in your job.
cons: In the last few years they are more concerned with pocketing money for the investors than they are about providing service for their customers and taking care of their employees.

pros:
Excellent pay and benefits
A very safety oriented working environment
A great company for military and police
cons:
Long and arduous work hours
No time for family life
If you don't like dealing with union folks, this is not the job for you

pros: Great pay - you have to work strange hours to do so, but you will make good money and gain a lot of experience.
cons: Hard hours and sleeping away from home - but that should be expected in this position. Hardest thing for me was not having a consistent pay and schedule.

pros: Great benefits, The ability to work outside being in charge of millions of dollars worth merchandise
cons: The lack of management, not paid enough for the time away from family

pros: Supply chain experience; company pension, work sites in 22 different states, opportunity for advancement if you are willing to move.
cons: The benefits that attracted me to the company are being cut.  The bonuses have been reduced, the health benefits have been reduced and the costs for the benefits have been increased.

review_title: Good paying job but a lifestyle not for everyone.
job_title: Diesel Locomotive Electrician in Melvindale, MI
pros: The pay is good an good retirement
cons: Poor lifestyle with the work schedule and the company as a whole has shifted from safety first to profit at all costs

pros: Norfolk Southern is a fantastic company to work for.  The company is always adapting to ensure a positive work environment and  to create a solid foundation for growth.  The company provides competitive benefits and excellent work / life balance.
cons: No cons to report for employment at NS.

pros: good benefits, and that's all I can say
cons: way to top heavy, poor management, and what was a good job is not so much anymore. corporate greed has ruined a good job and ruined many of families. they have cut everything to the bones due to PSR and people with 10-15 years are losing their jobs

review_title: No day is ever the same.
job_title: Railroad Freight Conductor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Pay and benifits and of course riding the rails. Old railroad mentality is leaving and a modern railroad  is underway.
cons: Family work balance. Pay during first six months of training is only 600 a week.

review_title: No good home life to many layoffs
pros: The pay and benefits are worth it to a family.The people you work with are in general good to work with
cons: The hours and the days off suck if you are low on the roster.Layoffs are a way of life in several crafts.

pros: 40 hours check guarantee..pretty saftey place to work at. Give good job briefing..
cons: No overtime . Always are willing to fired for anything. Don't believe in giving a second chance. Treat employees so bad makes them want to be in management .need more vacations

review_title: You must be one of the “Chosen Ones” to advance.
pros: Flexible schedule, decent pay, mostly good people around you.
cons: Mostly everyone only cares about themselves, and how far they can advance in the company. You will find yourself “under the bus” a lot.

review_title: Good job for someone without a college degree
pros: You can work without direct supervision. Work outside in different locations.
cons:
Work outside in all types of conditions....heat, cold, rain, night, etc...
Work all types of hours, not a regular schedule. Most of the time you will work 12 hours per shift.

pros: The money in good  and the benefits for the family are good too. the secure job is also a plus
cons: fear for your job. always having lower level supervisors lie to make them look good. The company allowing their lower managers fire people for non rule violations but for personal reasons.. this is a bad company... harsh tatics

pros: Great Benefits, Pay is good if you are working. Time off is not a problem.
cons: It is a union job and seniority rules. You will be on call 24/7 for years. When they do call you have two hours to show up. The call to work comes at the most inopportune time.

pros: Regular hours depending on shift. Duties assigned varies depending on management but most are regular and basic. Overall decent pay for duties.
cons: Hours can be varied but most will not be what you want. It is all depending on seniority. You will get it with time but starting off will be the worst hours.

pros: Benefits and retirement are excellent.  In house reduced cost day care in the Atlanta office.
cons: Conservative "old school" culture within the engineering department.  Reduced management workforce through attrition has increased workload and eliminated promotional opportunities.

review_title: Stay away! This company is not good for career or personal growth.
job_title: Trainmaster in Hacienda Heights, Los Angeles, Optional[CA]
pros: Average pay scale, average benefits
cons: Transportation department is very cut throat, long and exhausting hours. The regular workload is 60-70 hours a week. I once worked 50 hours straight when a derailment occurred at the very end of my regular work day. Off days are terrible (sun/mon), wed/thu, or Fri/sat). The company culture is toxic.

pros: You can make pretty decent money if you stay available 24/7 you also make a minimum guarantee pay rather you work or not.
cons: If you call off sick you forfeit your guarantee pay, management is horrible, they’ll fire you for anything.

job_title: Revenue Account Analyst in Atlanta, GA
pros: The pay. Your peers. Yearly merit raise.
cons: Horrible management. Expected to work overtime or on the weekends. Frowned upon if you actually left work when you were scheduled to leave. Lots of favoritism in this department. Revenue accounting has one the worst reputations in the company.

review_title: The Job was great, Managment was very poor.
pros: Good wages, not much else good the co-workers were in the same boat, a company that does not care about the employees
cons: poor management. Poor disiplinary policies. a company that does not care about the employees. this is a company that only cares about the bottom line. you get hurt, you are in a war to get back to work.

review_title: Good opportunity to begin a career
pros: Retirement, Pension, Salary, Health Benefits and 401K

pros: Environment is comfortable and mostly very laid back.  Start times are flexible and dress code isn't to strict.  building is in a good location.
cons: Good people aren't recognized enough, poor performance isn't reprimanded enough.  So there end up being some airheads around.  Bonuses have been few and low.

pros:
Great Pay
Incredible Benefits
Retirement Package

pros: good pay rate, great insurance, retirement

pros:
Very good company to start off your career..
good work and family life balance..
very good atmosphere to excel in your career if you have the right attitude.
they used to pay below market rate i guess they changed it now.
cons: technical training for new employees is ok not that great.

review_title: Great opportunity and experience for me.

- Competitive pay with housing bonus

- Full-time position similar to my intern responsibilities does not exist
- Company moves employees to new location every 2-3 years

review_title: The Worst Company to work for in America
pros: benefits and thats it

They don't not care about their employees what so ever. Will fly you to a location over 500 miles just to release you, by far the worst company in America to work for.

review_title: They hire you to fire you!
pros: You make a ton of money and you get decent benifits.

review_title: Great Company, Wrong People in Charge

Management

pros: Salary, benefits and co workers. The actual job is interesting and pretty easy as long as you have patience to sit around

pros: Not a whole lot of pros for working for this company. The medical benefits is the only thing decent and that is about to go to crap.
cons: The biggest con is the fact you can be fired for the smallest rule infractions. Middle and upper management sucks.

review_title: A good company, if you can take it.
job_title: Mechanical Supervisor in Fort Wayne, IN

review_title: This department is not organized and does not have a clear vision
pros: The benefits are among the best in the market. Provided you retire with the company, railroad retirement and pension benefits are really tops.
cons: This is an old company. Everything is old - even the way that management thinks about things.

pros: The money is good, as long as you're willing to sacrifice all of your time.
cons: Always away from home, but they warn you about that upfront. The main problem is management.

pros: great pay and great experience for my first job out of college
cons: over worked and often doing task of others without compensation ( too much delegation from senior management, you're basically doing their job while they sit back and tell their higher ups when its done then take the credit)

pros: good pay, and benes. union not so strong and seems to help the company more then the paying employees.
cons: management not so good lack personnel respect for employees..union not so strong and seems to help the company more then the paying employees.

review_title: This company believes it owns you

Low pay

No family time

pros: The pay and benefits are most of the reason why many people stay in the department.

Management
Work Schedule

review_title: It is a very stressful and time consuming job. Always worrying about if your gonna be laid off.

pros: Great Benefits and pay. Lot of opportunities to move up. First Few years in Management can be difficult.

pros: Good pay and benefits. A union shop.

review_title: Good Money, but not upward mobility
pros: My employees, the salary, that's it.

pros: If you want stability, this may be one of the place.

pros: Nice job great learning experience in order to prepare for success in the career field.

pros: Good starting pay without a degree.

pros: Pay and benefits were good.

pros: Great pay, insurance, and retirement.

review_title: Company promotes hostility and harassing managers

pros: Good pay, benefits and the work is fairly easy.

pros: Pay is very competivtive, no degree is nessasary, and many employees are union.
